title: Steamed Red Snapper With Fresh Ginger And Lime Recipe
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Steamed Red Snapper With Fresh Ginger And Lime Recipe a try. Watching your figure? This gluten free recipe has 636 calories, 90g of protein, and 25g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 3 and costs $7.95 per serving. Head to the store and pick up fish sauce, peanut oil, free email, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the fresh ginger you could follow this main course with the Fresh Ginger Cookies as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 1 hour. 1 person found this recipe to be scrumptious and satisfying. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 83%. This score is amazing. Try Steamed Red Snapper with Mushrooms and Ginger, Ginger Steamed Fish With Troy S Hana Style Sauce Recipe, and Halibut Steamed with Fresh Ginger for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A blend of three great vineyards, this vivid grape crafts a food-friendly wine, bright and pure. Gray it isn't. The knife-edged acid, with pear, lemon sorbet, spice and jasmine makes your mouth water and your hands shake.
